website_summaries.verdict: An excellent way to save on buying separate modem and router devices, and its good speed and superior Wi-Fi broadcasting range give it additional value.
pros: Power Boost feature amplifies your wireless signal to the legal limit for maximum home or office coverage
Approved by a wide range of internet providers
cons: This isn’t the fastest Motorola cable modem available, but this model will absolutely blanket the area with a solid Wi-Fi connection

customer_reviews.title: Quantum leap, money saver
customer_reviews.text: TWC Spectrum rents it's modem for $120 per annum. This is a better modem with solid WiFi that will quickly pay for itself.
customer_reviews.author: Child of Television

customer_reviews.title: Simplify your life and buy this modem!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two other modems to use for my Xfinity Internet, and spent a total of 2 days all day on the phone with both Xfinity and the company both tp-link and tenda, and I ended up having to send both products back because I could not get them to work after approximately 20 hours on the phone with customer service. This modem literally took only 5 minutes to set up with Xfinity and I had all three of my devices running instantly with no problems! I am so happy with the ease of setup! And Xfinity customer service told me that they have never had any problems with Motorola.
customer_reviews.author: Smash

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the investment. Not approved by Spectrum.
customer_reviews.text: This item lasted 4 months before it started dropping my internet connection multiple times per day. When I purchased this in March, it was recommended to me by Spectrum / TWC as a compatible modem/router for their services. The service technician confirmed for me today that Spectrum no longer supports this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Hines

customer_reviews.title: Suport is extremely bad a motorola really
customer_reviews.text: Suport is extremely bad a motorola really. Comcast told me they could not connect for a couple days because device was listed in another market. I brought new? After canceling my comcast account and having AT&T installed. Had same issue as your modem and the issue was had to register to AT&T account. Can not believe Motorola and Comcast service was so poor. They all treated me like a idiot and I work in technology for 40 years (Data bases and worked from home) and was never so insulted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly with Comcast. Easy to install even with no reading the manual. I recommend it and save money.
customer_reviews.author: SAMROS

customer_reviews.title: Disconnects easily and need to reset constantly
customer_reviews.text: Worked great at first, but in the past few weeks the WiFi just keeps dropping and I had to constantly reset it. The speed sometimes is a bit slow and it only works good for a while after I reset it. Also it does this thing that it disconnects for like a millisecond then tries to reconnect on its own, and this is just not great for me when I try to check out something online when the WiFi keeps getting disconnected. It really gets annoying when this happens more and more frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky Gu

customer_reviews.title: Unit is a lemon
customer_reviews.text: Wifi kept dropping. Spoke to Motorola who took me thru troubleshooting and then concluded that it was a lemon that should be returned. I see other reviews where the same problem was encountered and am wondering why Motorola has not looked deeper into this issue. A 5 - 10% defect rate is too high and points to a basic design flaw. Technician suggested MG7550 model; I need to decide whether to try that or stick with my cable provided $10/month rental.
customer_reviews.author: wonder woman

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought one years ago
customer_reviews.text: I have Spectrum internet (formally Brighthouse, formally Time Warner) and the modem they provide is straight from the 90's. I don't pay for a huge connection, just 50mbps. On a good day I was getting 20-25. I've called, complained about the lack of speed, asked for a new modem....nothing. $100 later and same day shipping, I installed this modem, called Spectrum and set it up. I ran a speed test and I had a 52mbps connection. I couldn't believe it, best money I've spent in a long time. Instructions were clear and I had it up and running with a new password and network name in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great cable modem/router, easy set-up too
customer_reviews.text: Ordered Sunday to acoid paying any more equipment fees for Xfinity. Received it Tuesday and hooked it up Wednesday. It came with LAN AND COAX cables along with power cord so after taking out old Xfinity modem/router I plugged in this new one along with COAX and turned it on. Nothing connected yet which is when I called Xfinity and activated it. The entire call was 20 minutes. After the call, internet is running fine. (FYI: remember to confirm over the phone that your renatal fee will come off your internet bill. The guy told me to just return the old one and they should be able to take off fee at the store... which is what happened.)
customer_reviews.author: RKmerica

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup, strong signal, and no lag in download speed. Worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: jh1900

customer_reviews.title: It was easy and fast to install
customer_reviews.text: My Wi-Fi internet speed increased exponentially with this modem. It was easy and fast to install.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I have Infinity Blast!, supposedly the fastest home download speeds. I ran the xfinity "speedtest" several times with the old modem. Results were 127 to 151 mbps. I then installed this (new) modem. Configuration was simple. I registered the new modem on-line. Ran "speedtest" again. Speeds increased to 250 mbps! Wow! Configured wireless on all my devices. Much stronger signal! Much more reliable! This modem is an absolute no-brainer. No more rental fees, easy installation, much faster downloads, much better wi-fi.
customer_reviews.author: Eclectic Reader

customer_reviews.title: Stop wasting money renting a modem/router!
customer_reviews.text: This was delivered today, and I had my internet connected and new WiFi up and running in 20 minutes. Extra bonus - I didn’t even have to call Comcast! I plugged my laptop directly into the modem with the Ethernet cable, and followed the instructions in the browser. The instructions that came with the modem were very clear as well. I should have done this years ago! Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: InsertNameHere

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: This has been in use about 2 weeks, and I've had to reset the unit twice. Router has pretty good signal; but I still installed a range extender to improve the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a modem with WIFI - make sure you order this if you have wireless
customer_reviews.text: We were told by Comcast the exact Motorola number modem we needed to purchase. We did just that but it did not work and Comcast said they did not know why it didn't work and we needed to call Motorola. After calling Motorola, they said that Comcast was directing almost all their Comcast customers to the wrong modem because we needed the one with wireless wifi which is the one I am writing about. This one was easy to use; easy to activate; and an all in one system.
customer_reviews.author: Wp Ashmore Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Disconnects constantly! Forget netflix or smart home devices.
customer_reviews.text: Works with xfinity, but unfortunately it constantly disconnects and I have to reset it... Very frustrating when my security cameras and other wifi enabled smart devices for my home are offline when I go to view them from work because the router doesn't stay connected. Very buggy, and would not recommend. Forget watching netflix, just watched a movie and had to reset the router 6 times in 2 hours.... Pretty ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Sky

customer_reviews.title: Nice cable modem/WiFi router
customer_reviews.text: Very nice unit. Used for cable Internet access provided by TDS. Works fine. Used to replace a Motorola MG7310 (new) in which the WiFi speeds declined drastically after that unit had been powered up for about 6 hours. (I returned that - Amazon made that very simple.) When the TDS tech people provisioned it it worked right away. But I have had some odd indications on the uplink status indicator, which occasionally shows "green" ("operating over a single channel only") even though the status screen shows three channels bonded for the uplink. But after a couple of restarts, I have not seen this for a while. So it may have been some fluke.
customer_reviews.author: DOUGLAS KERR

customer_reviews.title: First time ever installing...
customer_reviews.text: I usually have the kids come over and install this sort of thing, but I didn't want to wait in case I ordered the wrong type. It was EASY! This modem/router attached to my existing cable (that also has a wireless program) and attached to my older TV. The wireless printer works well with it. The Roku works well with it, the smartphones work well with it, the tablet works well with it, I don't game but imagine that would have no problems either. And I did it myself.
customer_reviews.author: wife of E J Brannan

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with 2019 Xfinity service. Date rate always trickles down to under 5mbps
customer_reviews.text: Not compatible with 2019 Xfinity service. I have a 100mbps service and from fresh reboot, the modem starts out only at around 24mbps then ALWAYS trickle down to under 5mbps. And that's within a few feet from the modem. Also causes issue with Xbox One console. It always logged me out of online gaming. Original modem was replaced by Motorola but the brand new replacement does the exact same thing. I am now renting a native Xfinity modem without any issue and runs at over 110mbps.
customer_reviews.author: UNBIASED REVIEWS

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had nothing but problems with mine. WiFi goes in and out on my LG tv and it seems to lower download speeds on mobile. It used to take seconds to download a podcast on my previous Netgear, this one can take 10 mins for the same download. If you’re watching YouTube on a mobile you have to constantly reconnect to keep it going. I went into the coding and changed what I could but it didn’t help what so ever. Even now I’m on mobile to write this because it’s not fast enough/won’t let me on to surf the web.
customer_reviews.author: S. Goss

customer_reviews.title: Defective out of the box. Read this as ZERO stars.
customer_reviews.text: A piece of garbage. Everything lit up, the cable company had a signal, but the router never appeared on my network list on the computer. After 3 tries and a conversation with both Comcast and Motorola, the Motorola tech said it was defective and I should return it. I am doing just that, but meantime, looking for another modem/router to buy. My old Motorola modem/router from 10 years ago is a star! Infuriating, since I need to set up Internet in another building.
customer_reviews.author: Rayna Gillman

customer_reviews.title: Controllable and Save Money
customer_reviews.text: If you are tired of paying the $10-$20/month for the use of the modems from the network provider that you are using, this is a great choice. The cost is only 10 months of renting from the provider. Then, you can control the security, allow only certain items to connect to the modem, block web addresses, adjust connection, etc. If you don't know a lot about modems, this is VERY simple to learn. Save the $100s on renting and buy your own. You won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for your XFinity modem. Works better, and you will save the $10 rental fee!
customer_reviews.text: I love this modem! It is completely compatible with Xfinity broadband. I called XFinity and they helped me with the set up. Essentially all they had to do was reset my line which I couldn't do at home. It's a simple install, just plug in the power cord and your coax cable, get it reset and you're good to go. It was easy to go the standard IP address 192.168.0.1, Username: admin Password: Motorola to change the SSID and Password back to your old one. It's stupid to pay the rental fee, and this will pay for itself in 10 months. On top of that, it's faster than the rental modem, which is another bonus.
customer_reviews.author: NCMan

customer_reviews.title: Complete dud.
customer_reviews.text: Returned at recommendation of Motorola customer support. First, the password was incorrect. Second, the wifi account wouldn't populate on any of my devices longer than 10 seconds. The router would have to be turned off and on just to get it to return for another 10 seconds. Works with Ethernet, but wifi was a complete dud. Based on other reviews, chances of a dud are high, so just skip it and buy a different modem/router. Not worth the chances.
customer_reviews.author: C206

customer_reviews.title: SLOW
customer_reviews.text: The signal strength is good. But I just replaced a Wireless Modem/Router and was easily getting >150Mbs. I am lucky (after reboot laptop ....etc), and only get ~45Mbs. Since I don't 'game' it is ok, but no where NEAR >300Mbs. May return it if it becomes an issue. Have not contacted Tech support. UPDATE: I am returning it and have ordered another (tad more expensive). I guess the quoted "Up To...." is tied directly (wired) via a LAN Cable. ??? Wireless is nowhere near.
customer_reviews.author: JaxDave

customer_reviews.title: Quality and Speed
customer_reviews.text: This modem and router works really well. I had a very old modem and router in two separate devices that gave a super slow Wi-fi, but this one is one device and it has significantly speeded up the Wi-fi. The device is light but it feels solidly built - there is a feel and look of quality. I am totally satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: C. Moon

customer_reviews.title: No problems so far. Edit: Now dropping wifi conenction.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this with Comcast Xfinity. I have had no problems wince installing it on Sep. 5, 2019. Today is Nov. 18, 2019. Following the Comcast instructions for connecting a new account with your own modem, the modem automatically connected to Comcast and I didn't even have to call them. Edit: 5/26/2020 Unit is now starting to drop the wifi connection, just as others have reported. The wifi connection just disappears. The only way to get it back is to unplug the unit and replug it. Reduced to two stars.
customer_reviews.author: NULL

customer_reviews.title: Totally reliable
customer_reviews.text: This is a great router. My number one requirement is reliability. This router has performed solidly for three months without ever requiring a restart. I have previously used routers from Arris and Netgear which would slow down and require restarting, sometimes several times in a day. The one complaint I have are the constantly blinking lights. The one nice feature of my Arris SURFboard router was a config option to completely disable blinking. However, total reliability trumps a minor irritation, so this merits five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Crosbie Smith

customer_reviews.title: Considering it's pretty much free after ten months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the Technicolor modem I was renting from Spectrum. I noticed an immediate and impressive difference with the Ethernet connection. My wife is in the other room streaming TV and browsing the internet, and she sees an impressive improvement as well. I can't check the range beyond 100 feet, as it's storming outside, but when I take my phone to the back of the house it's also snappier. Considering it's pretty much free after ten months, it's silly not to get one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ridgway

customer_reviews.title: This will NOT work with the xfi pods despite reviews here saying that you can use it with the pods
customer_reviews.text: This thing's modem IS comparable with Xfinity/ Comcast cable internet service BUT it is NOT compatible with their pods to create a mesh network for full home coverage as I was too it was. Monopogodalmighty xfugityvforces you to rent their modem/router for the pis to work. So u r stuck paying them even more month fees ~$25/mo. Just for the router. The only good news is that they own and maintain the unit. But you can't buy one from them at all so ur stuck paying more monthly fees. Yeah for moneyopolies. Word.
customer_reviews.author: SOB

customer_reviews.title: THINK TWICE...
customer_reviews.text: The recorded Motorola tech support [617-753-0562] hours from the recording were until 9pm EST. Was waiting for tech support on 2/29/20 Saturday afternoon EST from ~ 4:10 pm to 4:53 pm... 14 ahead of me at start. THREE calls processed during that time. I was #10 at 4:50 pm. At 4:53pm speakerphone announced their support was closing. No explanation whatsoever. 43 minutes completely wasted. Connection terminated by Motorola. Line went dead.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Buy at your own risk.
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about 1 week then all my devices showed a weak signal strength. My devices would only connect with good signal strength when the router was in the same room with the device. I've had many other routers placed in the same room that worked fine for many years until they became obsolete and I had to purchase a new one. This is the first time I have encountered this problem. Shipping experience was better than expect, but performance was way below my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: No More Paying For Rental Modems
customer_reviews.text: Provides strong signal through Ethernet and wifi in a 2500 square foot 2 story home. Never have connection problems like our old rental modem. Very big but had an elegant design and I'd definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: ShedWo

customer_reviews.title: Highly Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Highly Satisfied - Motorola phone support is excellent. A new Windows 10 update caused a glitch in the settings. The MS update changed the power settings to the energy efficient mode which caused me to have to reset after each restart of the computer. If I had saved maybe 20 dollars on a lower cost unit from another company I would have been out of luck. This inti works excellent as both a modem and as a Wi-Fi router. I live in a small apartment and have had no issues with Wi-Fi reception. I say do yourself a favor and go with a Motorola unit because of both quality and phone support.
customer_reviews.author: Strings

customer_reviews.title: Stop renting
customer_reviews.text: Like everybody else I didn't want to pay Comcast rental fee. I picked Motorola FBA_Mg7315-10 8X4 Cable Modem Gateway from Comcast's approved list for ease of installation and price. After unpacking, I took a picture of a label (on the bottom of unit) and printed it. It was useful when technician from Comcast asked for MAC number and when I needed a password. It was simple to change the network name and password to previous one. I'm not a gamer, so the speed is not that important. With the Comcast modem, my iphone was dropping WiFi signal several times a day, with Motorola 7315 it hasn't happened yet.
customer_reviews.author: rr

customer_reviews.title: Great at first.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace my modem which I rented from Comcast. It fit my needs and seemed great. At first it was fantastic. It had great connectivity and high speeds throughout my home. Suddenly about a couple of months ago I began experiencing buffering while watching movies on a TV in my basement. I did some speed tests with a laptop and found that my speeds were 32 times higher near the router than in the basement now. They were much closer when I installed it in January 2018.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Kempisty

customer_reviews.title: Pros - Super easy to set up right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Pros - Super easy to set up right out of the box. Easy to configure online if you desire to change the SSID and password. You can also change the operating channel if you are experiencing interference from a neighbor. Cons - Is not as fast as the router that Comcast installed. Comcast router tested at 179 Mbps, Motorola testes at 92 Mbps. Upload speed was roughly the same for both routers. Now, having said that, I am still happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck C

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well, have it hooked up to xfinity/Comcast network with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: El-Dave-O

customer_reviews.title: Setup was very easy out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was in 2 days as promised. Installation was very easy but write down the MAC address and serial number so you don't have to keep flipping it over to get the numbers. I had to call in to get it connected but that was only a small delay. Once it was running for a day I was getting better speed and faster wireless speeds. I am very happy with my purchase and would recommend it to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: John Cooley

customer_reviews.title: I bought this to replace a much older cable modem ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a much older cable modem. I couldn't believe that this was so much slower with the newer technology. Plus it needed rebooted at least every week. I would send it back but it's just past the time limit & now I'm stuck. Oh well, lesson learned. I have replaced it with a Netgear C6300. It is much faster. (It should be 16x4 vs 8x4)
customer_reviews.author: Rick C.

customer_reviews.title: It is very stable and was fairly easy to sync with my Comcast service
customer_reviews.text: The modem works exactly as I need it. It is very stable and was fairly easy to sync with my Comcast service. The device comes with directions on how to setup the name and pword, etc. The only reason it doesn't have the final star, is because I wish the wireless internet was a bit stronger (reach further) and a bit more stable. Other than that it's a great product and much more stable than the one they make you rent from xfinity.
customer_reviews.author: Kalen Hamada

customer_reviews.title: Works with Optimum
customer_reviews.text: This modem is very fast compared to the one I was renting from Optimum. Very easy to hook up. I had to call Optimum to have it activated which was fine. Well worth it and very nice modem. Also this modem is a router as well so it is all you need. Great Product !!
customer_reviews.author: Bee Well

customer_reviews.title: Save your central nervous system some stress and DON'T BUY!
customer_reviews.text: If you need to get a signal over 30' away, don't purchase this unit. If you want to stream to your TV, don't buy either as your signal will constantly be in a buffering mode. Guarantee you that it isn't my internet service as I generally have a minimum of 72mps on my DSL service. I have a tri-level home and it won't stream to my 65" Sony 43 feet away but even worse it constantly buffers the signal to my Samsung smart TV in my living room 23' away without anything between the unit and TV. Service? Well there's really none!
customer_reviews.author: Craig from Idaho

customer_reviews.title: Strong signal, easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Hooked this up in my 1100sq.ft. apartment because I didn't want to pay Comcast an extra $14/month for their equipment. Setup was easy and the signal is strong in every room (and even outside on the porch). If you're using this with Comcast/Xfinity, you would need to call their customer service line and have them register it.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect for Comcast
customer_reviews.text: We bought this instead of paying for the monthly subscription. Works perfect and reaches all three levels of our town home with great reception.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Stoker

customer_reviews.title: So far its great!
customer_reviews.text: Got this 6/21/2020, set it up 6/22/2020. Seems to work a bit better than the modem we were renting from xfinity. Easy set up for sure. Im not very tech savvy and was able to have it going withing 10-15 minutes if that. Its nice because they have directions to keep your current username and password so you don't have to log in to all your devices again. Id say its worth the investment, will save a bit of money now not having to rent one. If we come into any issues I'll be sure to update!
customer_reviews.author: Amd123

customer_reviews.title: I am really pleased with this quite modem that allows me to use ...
customer_reviews.text: I am really pleased with this quite modem that allows me to use the 100 megabites provided by my new service provider.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but not for gaming
customer_reviews.text: It was somewhat difficult to get set up, took 3 tries to get connectivity and I have a degree in computer network administration so take that for what its worth. Overall it is about 1/3 the speed I get from my comcast issues router so I would not recommend this for gaming but I have been streaming Netflix and hulu for 2 weeks without issue so for the average person it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomerz8675309

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly with Comcast
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly with Comcast's 10Mbps @ at an actual 12Mbs (same as my old Dlink modem). Looks like it could work faster if I had a faster connection. Easy to hookup without instructions and took Comcast tech support about 20 min ti activate it. I am running 2 computers, my Vonage modem (Ethernet) and my Roku (wireless) through this modem router, all with no problem. Although slower than my old Century link connection definitely runs better and with smoother streaming.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Seda

customer_reviews.title: Excellent -- for the first year
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and it's still very reliable when used with an ethernet connection. However, after about a year the wifi started being sporadic. I couldn't find it even when I looked for it. Then, maybe 18-24 hours later, it magically reappeared. No problems for a few days/weeks/hours, then rinse and repeat. Lately the wifi's been unavailable far more often than not -- I really can't rely on it. I've had it for under a year and a half so honestly ... the cost isn't proving to be that much less than if I'd rented it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: reset issue
customer_reviews.text: I was renting a Comcast modem/router for WAY too long and wasting money. I decided to just buy my own. I would say the speed and signal are about the same with this modem/router vs. Comcast rental. I even tested speeds to compare. Why three stars? Often enough my WIFI shows active on my iphone top bar, however, there is no connection (i.e. gmail app says no internet). I then have to turn WIFI on/off on my iphone and it works. It often happens in the morning mostly. It is annoying!
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: or I might be lucky to get a good one.
customer_reviews.text: Fast Shipping The installation was charm with Xfinity. Put the cable, switched on power. I was trying to access the internet using the new wifi from my laptop. Within 10 minutes i got a pop up from Xfinity to confirm the new equipment and required to enter the Comcast credentials. That's it Never needed to call Comcast support :) Went to Comcast and returned their modem. Did not faced any disconnection issues some users were complaining about. It might be a manufacturing defect, or I might be lucky to get a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I had to upgrade to a newer wifi/cable modem due to watching Amazon Prime. My old Motorola which worked great for the last four years just could not keep up with the video streaming of either 720 or 1080 P. This works great. Wifi signal is received in all parts of our 3000 square foot house including out in the back yard. Steve Austin, Texas Progreso, YUCATAN, Mexico
customer_reviews.author: Steven John

customer_reviews.title: Like other reviewers
customer_reviews.text: ok, I've only had it for a day, but I am finally getting the speed I am paying for with comcast. Like other reviewers, I really regret renting for so many years. With the rental I was getting half the speed I pay for and frequent disconnections, wifi dropping off all the time, waiting and getting no where with comcast support on the phone. The set-up was very easy. It take about 5 mins. for the new modem to light up fully, then you logon and within seconds, I was online, at twice the speed! Rental modem gave me average of 12-15 download speed. With this, I am getting consistent 27!
customer_reviews.author: Jujubeans

customer_reviews.title: Easy to configure for wireless cameras via port forwarding
customer_reviews.text: Easy to configure for wireless cameras via port forwarding. Good speed and wireless range. I tried this one after not being able to setup port forwarding on the NetGear C6300 which I returned.
customer_reviews.author: Maxx

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: I was wrong It broke at the beginning of May. It was plugged into a surge protector, but it just stopped working still powers up but the WiFi portion shut off and the hardwire router stopped working as well. It lasted four months and three weeks. This was the recommended modem by the ISP.
customer_reviews.author: N. Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 6 Months
customer_reviews.text: After 6 months after purchased it doesn’t get signal. Lights are on. Service provider ran all the tests and said the router is defective. Calling Motorola tomorrow 8/19/20. After all it says it has a 2 yrs warranty if undamaged, but I will have to pay for shipping. Already a nightmare to not have internet while in quarantine. I’ll be back to tell if Motorola respected the warranty or not
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Completely outdated
customer_reviews.text: I had bought this one to replace my Comcast box but it kept dropping service if we were 30 feet away from it. We live in an old row home so that was a non-starter. Called the helpline and they told that it was way too old compared to what I had before and they gave me the name of the next one up (7550) and it works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: A. Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Performs as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with my purchase of the Motorola MG7315 cable modem with N450 WI-FI router. The installation was easy and I had no problem activating it with COX Cable. My internet has been solid with no drop outs and the WI-FI reaches all parts of my house. The unit is well ventilated and does not run hot. My internet speed meets or exceeds what I am supposed to get from COX. Good modem.
customer_reviews.author: Greenfield

customer_reviews.title: Positively surprised
customer_reviews.text: Positively surprised. I read the reviews on Amazon and was first very skeptical, but as of the first few days of use the range is better than the one Comcast is leasing, the internet speed is not limited or downgraded by the modem/router. First configuration happened automatically when I plugged in the Comcast cable, but the product has to be reconfigured by Comcast tech support. The call was a bit long (I think they were trying to play hard ball so I would get back to their modem), but after 20 min they remotely reconfigured my modem and done. Easy saving of $10/month.
customer_reviews.author: Zohar Bartfeld Shapiro

customer_reviews.title: Should have lasted longer
customer_reviews.text: For the money we paid for this I would have expected to get longer out of it. Worked great up until a couple months ago and now we are constantly Star my getting kicked off our network, the apps on our tv keeps telling us we have no internet and we have to reset the modem probably 3-4 times per day. It’s just not working anymore and now we have to shop for another modem. It’s frustrating
customer_reviews.author: Momof3Beans

customer_reviews.title: SLOW
customer_reviews.text: This is a dated product, do not purchase. It only has one one frequency (2.4gHz) vs other gateways allowing 2 (2.4 and 5 gHz). I am only getting 7.5 mbps speed when using wireless, and get +175mbps when using a direct connection. I cannot stream videos when the modem is less than 2 feet from the FireStick. Service on this product is equivalent of navigating a maze - calling 4-5 different numbers to get no resolution.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great Until It Didn't and Ridiculous Charge from Moto Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device at the beginning of January when I moved apartments and it worked great the first month. Come February I could not get internet service so I reached out to my cable company who said it was working fine from their end. Got ahold of Motorola customer service which was great at first and the guy ran test on the phone and ultimately decided a replacement was needed. Turns out that I am responsible for the costs associated with returning the defective device...seems a bit ridiculous to me since it is only a month old and I've done nothing to the device.
customer_reviews.author: Kiley Wuellner

customer_reviews.title: Fine for cable modem - Horrible as wireless
customer_reviews.text: I get 70 mbps down when hard wired to the cable modem but when I use the embedded wireless its worthless. To be fair it may be all the signals in my apt but most good wireless now have conflict channel checking. I guess I'll get a longer cable or possibly try a different wireless device and see if changes anything. Also please note you can't update the firmware on this device the only way to update it is a push from the cable company. Just say no to Cable!
customer_reviews.author: Om Namo

customer_reviews.title: Economy modem/router
customer_reviews.text: Descent coverage for 1000 sqft single floor. Has 4 ethernet ports. For speeds under 50mb service, the 2.4ghz signal is steady so far without any issues using xfinity’s service. Definitely recommend it to save rental fees.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after only 5 months.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to keep from paying Comcast the $13 per month rental on a modem. Now 5 months later it has failed. And there was two months that I was away and it didn't get used. The Wi-Fi seems to work fine for e-mail and searching, but I can not stream anything, can't even connect to Amazon Prime, Netflix, Acorn etc. Amazon told me to contact the manufacturer. Wish me luck.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product about 10 days. Wifi signal is not stable and even worse no signal at all. After reset It works for a while then again no Wifi. I have older Motorola version which works better than this product. I have talked to Comcast and they don't have any problem in their end. Funny thing is Xfinity hotspot is faster than my it's Wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Tvshn

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for us
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to be able to return the Comcast box and stop paying the monthly rental fee. We started having internet issues that we never had before. Randomly throughout the day we couldn't access the internet for the tv, phone, laptop, Peloton. I had a friend check it out and said we probably got a lemon. Luckily I didn't rerun the Comcast box (Covid closure). I plugged back our old equipment & we haven't had a problem since. I never would have wrote this review but I'm made because I returned this 3 weeks ago and still haven't received a refund! That's unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: E.L.

customer_reviews.title: excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: I use spectrum internet and the modem that was provided with the service was absolutely terrible. the internet connection would drop constantly and if we had guests over that wanted to use the wifi forget about ever connecting to the internet we might as well not even have an internet subscription. I like to stream overwatch and the lag made playing practically excruciating. But not with this product! everyone in the house has noticed the difference since we've switched. it's only been about two weeks and neither of us have had their wifi connection drop and everything is super fast now. Setting it up was pretty easy too, only took about five minutes. would definitely recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for exactly one month.
customer_reviews.text: This product worked as for about the first month now it will not register with Comcast only the lights one and two will stay lit up in the picture it looks like the globe and light three are lit but it's from a reflection cannot reset the Box can't do anything with the box it is frozen with only lights one and two you can unplug it and plug it back in and it's still light one and two. The box is no good.
customer_reviews.author: Hard Worker

customer_reviews.title: Intermittent Wi-Fi, Terrible Product
customer_reviews.text: Do not let the low cost and simple set-up fool you - the execution of the router/modem combo is absolutely awful. Anything more than one device seems to destroy the bandwidth of all devices running. I have only a few devices - a couple of computers and a phone - and ever since installing it would never be able to run any of them. I upgraded to a separate modem and router and everything was fixed instantly. This is a horrible product.
customer_reviews.author: I. H.

customer_reviews.title: This router was extremely easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: This router was extremely easy to setup. Have it linked to Comcast. Works as it should... Very rarely have a problem that requires us to restart. Have been using this product for 6 months had to restart it maybe 3 times. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Richard J.

customer_reviews.title: Customer service is poor
customer_reviews.text: First time i called I was number 15, when i reached number 9 they hang up on me asking me to call another time. I emailed them asking them to call me per their suggestion, but that never happened. The second time i called, i was number 11 and when the rep answered he asked me to hold. I was on hold for 5 minutes, could hear him taking a break. He said he was exhausted and that most people wait for 1/2 hour or more. Problem was not solved, so need to call back again :(
customer_reviews.author: Marj

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous modem/router!
customer_reviews.text: I am far from a technical genius and the installation was simply hook it up and call the internet provider to activate. I have had no problems with connectivity or speed. I have 5 devises that connect to the wi-fi and never a problem. The w-ifi signal is much stronger and wider range than I anticipated. I get fully signal in every room of the house and in the basement. My cell phone was still connected at the end of the street!
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Nice wifi range
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install and set up .. the only thing you must do before use it .. call your internet provider infinity ny case only ask a couple questions and they will register your serial and mac address and works ...
customer_reviews.author: Roy rojas

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup in works great no issues.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit because I was tired of renting one from my cable provider. Set up was as easy as calling Xfinity and have them activate the modem which I did by chat I can never understand their customer service representative. I live in a 2 bedroom apartment and my signal strength is excellent throughout. I've had it about a week and I've had zero issues, I've streamed movies over the web with no lag, surfed the web, and have numerous devices connected with the no issues. Seems to be a great modem for the price highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Blanchard

customer_reviews.title: Mostly as Expected
customer_reviews.text: I guess I am to blame, but when the product description said 8 channel, I interpreted that to mean beyond dual band. Not so, as this unit transmits only at 2.4GHz. Other than that misunderstanding, it is working as expected. The setup was also a bit different from the instructions, but in the end it wasn't hat hard.
customer_reviews.author: Scott from Aurora, CO

customer_reviews.title: Could be better.
customer_reviews.text: It works great for the wifi and internet SOMETIMES. But Im also a gamer. And since i installed this modem I always get kicked out of xbox live. When I check the multiplayer network it say the internet is ok but i will have matchmaking issues. Also my phone wifi stops working for no reason. i have to disconnect from the wifi and then start again... Im not happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Cris

customer_reviews.title: Better than renting one from the provider
customer_reviews.text: If you buy a modem rather than renting one, you will save a lot of money. After researching several options, I settled on this one. Price was right, it was easy to set up, and two years later, it's still working like a charm. Need I say more?
customer_reviews.author: Jane Elliot

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and works
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the cheaper modems and works great with Comcast. The only time it doesn’t work is if Comcast is being Comcast.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Grabage!
customer_reviews.text: Recently switched from CenturyLink to Xfinity because of a student deal but guess what!!! Instead of 200 Mbps, I was getting only 10 Mbps. Doing online classes with such low speed was a nightmare until a great techie from Xfinity came, found no issue with their cables, and suggested replacing this piece of trash with a specific tp-link modem which is working perfectly and as of now, I'm getting 230 Mbps with the wired connection and about 140 Mbps while using WiFi.
customer_reviews.author: Hamidreza Nekoui

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and working great
customer_reviews.text: This unit was easy to install and was up and running in a short time. I'm not a techie so it was important I could do this myself. I phoned the Comcast phone number provided and had it activated in a timely manner. Read some reviews and was comfortable this would suit my needs. Speed is better on my laptop and other devices. I was able to customize the WiFi name and password, and my devices connected fairly seamlessly. Makes sense to purchase after paying the monthly rental fee for the past few years.
customer_reviews.author: M. S. Powell

customer_reviews.title: Bought this to replace my rented comcast modem. I ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my rented comcast modem. I used speedtest.net and speeds are slightly faster than the motorola that Comcast gave me. It is also good-looking. My modem/router is a dark charcoal, which you can't really appreciate from the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Stef

customer_reviews.title: Router works great, no problem installing
customer_reviews.text: Router works great, no problem installing, hooked it up and it was ready in about five minutes. Xfinity put an activation page on computer, filled in some info and done. I have an 1800 sq. ft. house and coverage is excellent inside an outside, better than the Xfinty router.
customer_reviews.author: old smokey

customer_reviews.title: Modem works pretty good, will keep for now.
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good and better range than the rented comcast modem, but every other day I have to reset it (either wifi signal dies or gets really slow). The range was weak with the Comcast modem, but never had to touch it and consistently worked. Not sure if all modems need to be rebooted every few days. Not a big deal just inconvenient at times, would rather spend a little more on a modem where you dont need to mess with it if that exists.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Y. Liu

customer_reviews.title: Excellent modem, strong signal
customer_reviews.text: I bought this modem to replace the xfinity (also Motorola). It is not a 5Ghz model but works very nice in 2.4GHz band (BGN). The coverage is amazing. I have a full bar in 3 story house (including the basement) through the street. Very reliable and easy to configure. My wireless printer was discovered quickly and work out-of-the-box. Strongly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Julia R

customer_reviews.title: If you don't care about WiFi speeds this modem/router is for you.
customer_reviews.text: If you use an ethernet hookup, then this baby does the job. Unfortunately, I ordered this for mostly WiFi, and I was getting download speeds ranging from 22mb - 55mb (I have a 250mb package with Xfinity). So this was a deal breaker. I thought I might have a defective unit, so I returned it for a replacement, but the replacement was just as bad. I'm returning both units and going with an Arris dual band.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Fasanelli

customer_reviews.title: Only semi-usable for TWC/Spectrum—Buyers Beware
customer_reviews.text: So this was super easy to install and activate but anyone on Time Warner/Spectrum beware they only push up to 100mbps through this modem/router. What can only be contributed to price fixing and corporate partnerships by my guess. It's a decent device for the price but if you want more than 100mbps you're going to have to go the next tier up.
customer_reviews.author: Unknown

customer_reviews.title: Cant go wrong (works with xfinity)
customer_reviews.text: Works great for xfinity. I live in California (if that matters) and was a bit skeptical about this working for xfinity. Decided to just bite the bullet and go for it. Install was fairly easy - follow the booklet. Tech guy activated my internet and then I connected soon after. Would Recommend as this product is fairly cheap and easy, also a stable wireless signal.
customer_reviews.author: M.Xiong

customer_reviews.title: speed demon - no problems
customer_reviews.text: Speed demon, no problems at all. This was easy to set up and I don't think I've even bothered to restart it in 9 months of ownership. My girlfriend claims to get wifi reception at a restaurant down the street from my house but my coverage is limited to about half a city block in all directions. Our structure is made of solid brick and plaster which is pretty tough on radio waves. Wired speed is top notch.
customer_reviews.author: J. Nicholson

customer_reviews.title: Limited performance - Bandwidth restrictive. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.text: As stated, the modem is compliant with Comcast however, you do not have full function of bandwidth. My bandwidth was cut by 2/3. Comcast said that the modem could not be adjust even if they could. You are better off leasing a modem from Comcast and having better internet speed rather then spending time on the phone with Comcast wondering why you can't even stream a video online.
customer_reviews.author: Viper

customer_reviews.title: The wireless is great and much better than my older Linksys E1200 which ...
customer_reviews.text: Owned this for a few months now with RCN as my ISP. The wireless is great and much better than my older Linksys E1200 which use to require a powercycling every couple of weeks. Thanks for the 4 Gig ports, I actually started to hard wire some parts of the house where I would like to take full advantage of the speed from my ISP. This includes two TVs running Chromecasts with PoE connectors and a PC on the 2nd floor.
customer_reviews.author: theENDtype

customer_reviews.title: Duplicate MAC address
customer_reviews.text: According to Comcast the MAC address labeled on this modem was in use by another account. The MAC address is supposed to be unique so I had to return this modem. I am not sure if this is the reseller’s fault or Motorola.
customer_reviews.author: Omid

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install, but...
customer_reviews.text: This was really easy to install, using instructions included with the modem/router, as well as instructions from the Xfinity web site. My only complain is that there is no connection to my phone, which I didn't even know to look for, so I guess I will either have to get rid of my landline or figure out another way to get phone service.
customer_reviews.author: MD MD

customer_reviews.title: Buy or die
customer_reviews.text: Netgear módem wasn’t doing it anymore. Switched to this bad boy I was getting about 80 mbps and then once I installed this I got 170 mbps.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Drop the cheap one your ISP "rents" to you
customer_reviews.text: I was just using the one Comcast gives you for the longest time and I thought it was running at an optimal speed because I didn't know any better. After getting tired of paying Comcast monthly I decided to just buy a modem/router combo of my own and was blown away by the difference in speed. I went from 20mb using Comcasts up to 75-80mb (which means your Netflix/hulu which ever streaming service you use) will never freeze or slow or look grainy. Very easy to set up and use. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B

customer_reviews.title: No wifi connection
customer_reviews.text: I connected everything just like my Comcast modem was connected, it would not connect to Wi-Fi, I called Comcast and they couldn't get it done either, after so many tries I boxed it up and it is going back. Comcast said they could send a technician out to my house for a fee but wouldn't tell me what the fee would be. So not with it maybe I will try a more expensive modem.
customer_reviews.author: FFC

customer_reviews.title: Motorola Modem
customer_reviews.text: I have installed many modems so this was easy. I called the cable company and got online with them just fine and things are working well. My smart tv connection went right away without endless buffering so that was a plus. Great product & I have never been disappointed with Motorola products.
customer_reviews.author: V. Shepherd

customer_reviews.title: Good wifi, terrible hardwired
customer_reviews.text: This is relatively inexpensive and works in general as a wireless gateway. Plugging directlyy into it does NOT jave the same outcome. Every once in a while my xbox would work while plugged in (which is the ideal way to play online) but the vast majority of the time it wouldnt connect properly and i would have to use wifi. Extremely disappointed in this. Im in the market for a new modem as we speak.
customer_reviews.author: MetalMessiahCKD

customer_reviews.title: Low range and then died after 13 months
customer_reviews.text: Weak range. We couldn't close our bedroom door or the smart tv would lose signal. Our house isn't that big and there were many places where there was just no signal. We had to hard wire both computers. We struggled along and then it did us a favor and stopped broadcasting a signal at all. I am actually happy it died so we HAD to replace it!
customer_reviews.author: S.A.

product_meta.title: MOTOROLA MG7315 8x4 Cable Modem Plus N450 Single Band Wi-Fi Gigabit Router with Power Boost, 343 Mbps Maximum DOCSIS 3.0 - Approved by Comcast Xfinity, Cox, Charter Spectrum
feature_bullets: 8x4 DOCSIS 3.0 cable Modem Plus a built-in N450 single band (2.4 GHz) Wi-Fi Gigabit Router with four Gigabit (GigE) Ethernet ports, a firewall, and more. This product is recommended for DOCSIS 3.0 and 2.0 cable services. For DOCSIS 3.0 services, this modem provides actual Cable internet service speeds up to 145 Mbps. A Broadcom Cable Modem Chipset provides security from denial of service attacks.

Requires cable internet service. Approved by and for use with Comcast Affinity and Xfinity x1, Cox, Charter spectrum, time Warner Cable, brighthouse, WOW!, Cable one, rcn, Mediacom and other cable service providers. Eliminate cable Modem rental fees up to 132 dollars per year. (Savings are shown for Affinity and vary by cable service provider. No cable Modem is compatible with fiber optic, DSL, or satellite services from Verizon, AT&T, CenturyLink, and others. Model MG7315 has no phone jack.)

Built-in high-speed Wi-Fi router with N450 Wi-Fi and Power boost provides internet access for Wi-Fi devices including smartphones, notebooks, tablets, game stations, HDTVs, Amazon echo, Google home, Chromecast, Roku, Amazon Fire TV, and Apple TV. Four 10/100/1000 Gigabit Ethernet LAN ports provide wired connections to Windows and Mac computers, HDTVs, game stations, streaming TV devices, and other ethernet-capable devices.

Wireless power boost adds high-performance Wi-Fi power amplifiers to boost the wireless signals to the legal limit, giving a significant Boost in speed and range. In addition, anybeam beamforming focuses the signal on wireless clients to further enhance performance and range.

Integrating the cable Modem and router creates a more reliable connection that reduces unwieldy wiring and power adapter clutter while conserving desk space. The vertical design further minimizes shelf space, improves cooling, and extends product life while looking great in any home or office.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars2,490 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
